defaultValue: This is the area were you can enable / disable fetures.

fieldDescription: If set to true, when starting a new game factions will create there own randomly generated starlords, provided said faction does not already have any
If set to true, starlord will beable to die. in additional, new starlords will enter the game as time goes on

fieldName: Enable additonal lords for all faction
fieldDescription: if set to true, every faction will beable to gain additional starlords. regardless of if they already have starlords or not

defaultValue: This handles the number of lords generated per total market size of a given faction.
This handles the number of additonal lords generated in each faction. this is a static amount

This handles the odds of a given starlord of a given tier having a fief at game start.
please keep in mind that if to many starlords are selected for a fief, some starlords will be compleatly unable to gain a fief, regardless of how high you set this setting

fieldName: Odds of fief for tier 0 starlords
Odds of fief for tier 1 starlords
Odds of fief for tier 2 starlords

defaultValue: Enable or disable parts of this feture here (only works if life and death is enabled)
This is the limits to spawn amounts (the life and death system will not allow lords to spawn or be killed when past thease values)
this is the limits to spawn amounts (lord spawn / death raits will be modified by the _ values when past the soft min and max values)

This controls the number of 'ponits' a market needs to generate to spawn a lord, as well as how quickly each market can generate ponits
each market holds its own store of 'ponits' it uses to generate starlords. ponits are gained every month
the equation used is ((size X multi per size) + (exspodent per size^size)) X 1-(missing stability X stability loss)
this feture, if enabled, allows for 'exstreamests' to spawn (such as pirates, to luddic path) instead of the factions own starlord if stability is low enouth.

fieldName: Odss of exstreamests per missing stability below par

defaultValue: This controls the chance a lord will upfront die in a given battle
This handles all the ratio of a given markets 'starting ponits'. (as such allowing vareance of when lords start to spawn on new game)
